data.title: Great seafood in the desert!
data.text:
I go here for their seafood dishes. They have a variety of seafood, fish, shrimp, etc. Their fried shrimp are well seasoned and served with a healthy plate of side dishes, rice and beans, and salad. Drinks are large and inexpensive.

They have both indoor and covered outdoor seating. Televisions inside are generally tuned to soccer (all year round it seems). Indoor area can get crowded as it is somewhat small with about six booths. Plates average about $13.95 for seafood, and $11.95 for turf items.

data.title: amazing
data.text: great people, very friendly  the food is super good so are there margaritas. the patio dinning area it beautiful at night. great place to eat with family or as a date night also fairly cheap for the quality of food ..

data.title: Tarasco
data.text: The shrimp wrapped in bacon is awesome! Chips and salsa was very fresh, the service was great! I totally enjoyed the food.

data.title: Awesome Shredded Beef Tacos
data.text: Love this place! Their shredded beef tacos are great! The refried beans are so good! The outdoor eating area feels like you are in Mexico on vacation. Highly recommend!

data.title: The best Mexican Food in Perris
data.text:
I regularly come here to eat.  Price is typical and meal size is a healthy serving comparable to other restaurants but I come here because of the food quality (like mama cooked it), because of the warm friendly service and because of the relaxing outdoor patio.  These make it a very enjoyable meal even on hot days (which we have a lot of here).  It is a family place, a great place to take a client (did this with one client and he now comes regularly with his wife).  There is a portion of the patio with large tables so you could have a big family get-to-gether.  I would call to plan a large group.  It is to me the best Mexican Resturant in Perris.
Enjoy
Bob

data.title: Hidden gem...easily missed....local favorite
data.text: We drive from Colorado to see my Dad, always a stop on the second night...first night not so much....we like to be awake enough to enjoy.  Easily missed little gem of a place, if not for the colorful painted Tarasco sign out front....lucky for us, our family knows about this place, essentially because they stumbled on it one day when on the prowl for good Mexican food.  Make no mistake this place is not fancy, and that is a good thing...life is regulated enough without having to worry about appearances, or dress, or oh so-so manners...  First thing you notice...as you walk up and in the patio courtyard is the shade, the relaxing ambiance ...tables seated far enough from each other that you have some privacy and do not feel like you are on top of each other, there is an indoor dining area, though have never been inside....the patio is so inviting, why bother.  There is also a nice little fountain in one corner that is kind of elevated, a table nearby, the birds are singing there little heads off..and playing as birds do in the water.  The waitress was johnny-on-the spot, salsa and chips and getting drink orders squared away, margaritas are good, but beer could be colder.  The menu is extensive...you have landed in a sort of Mexican restaurant nirvana..the choices are endless.  Good burrito but huge, could serve two easily....really good cheese enchiladas, the rice and beans good also.  The wait staff is attentive, but not to the point that you feel you are being hurried along...the whole atmosphere is conveyed as..".we are not in a hurry, and you do not need to be either...so sit, relax, enjoy"...good times...highly recommend.

data.title: Goes beyond the usual items on a Mexican menu
data.text: Wonderful setting. We ate outdoors under a canopy of vines and branches protected from the sun. The menu included more seafood than I usually see including octopus. The taco shells were handmade and very tasty. The taco meat was shredded beef not ground beef. Breakfast was served all day. I look forward to trying this place again.

data.title: Best Mexican Food in Perris
data.text: The food was fabulous and the service was great. I would dine there every time when on that side of town.

data.title: Very nice experience at a local restaurant.
data.text:
I had the two chile rellenos dish, which tasted just like a home made meal.  We were a party of 15, with previous reservation; the food arrived reasonably fast  The prices are fair, the ambiance inviting.  We dined outside.
One area to improve: Ad a light to the hallway leading to the restrooms and have paper towels.

data.title: Very average with great service
data.text: Stopped for late breakfast and was impressed by the service and outdoor patio seating. They were very friendly and prompt. Food was OK but average and plenty of it. They do serve beer, wine and margaritas. They also have a huge selection of seafood. Since we only stopped for a late breakfast did not get a chance to see and taste any dinner items so don't know about them. Very busy place.

data.title: Good
data.text: Pretty good food , good prices and great service - nice atmosphere all my favorite dishes,enchiladas, TAco, Mole- worth another try when I'm in the area-nice patio - but we are inside

data.title: Great mexican food
data.text: Great food and friendly staff. Both patio and indoor seating. Good prices for the amount of food you are served. street parking and parking in back with a back entry to the patio area. Older building but has character. Great place to eat on those warm spring and fall evenings.

data.title: A Delightful Find in the Middle of Nowhere
data.text:
Huge menu with a broad variety of authentic foods that represent various regions of Mexico.  The chile relleno was light and flavorful, absolutely "sabroso!"
We also enjoyed the Soup of the 7 Seas.  However, my daughter ordered the red posole, and in addition to the pork and a couple of soup bones, there was an assortment of "alfaul" (sp?). which isn't for everyone.
The restauant has a beautiful patio, but no heat.  (It was cold and drizzly, so we sat inside.)  The restroom was clean, but not enough attention was given to wiping down the tables.  The menus were sticky and filled with bread crumbs.  I would return to this funky little establishment should I ever pass through The town of Perris again.

data.title: Good food locally
data.text: Good food ,good drinks,reasonable prices,worth a stop!The newly Renovated downtown is adjacent.Eat and stroll away the calories !

data.title: Very good Old Mexico Restaurant
data.text: We went there for a business lunch about 1:15 on Thursday. With hardly anyone there, maybe guests at four patio tables, we sat in the garden area filled with ambiance. The waitress brought chips and salsa, and the salsa was among the best anywhere. Fresh, fresh, fresh.  Chips were fine. We ignored other reviewers who recommended the burritos and other dishes, and we ordered beef fajitas to share. Plenty of food for two.  Fajitas were good, not great.  Beans and rice were okay.  Flour tortillas were fine. Roasted jalapeños were very good. I kept going back for more excellent salsa to help carry the meal. Should have followed the other reviewers and ordered the burritos.  I'll go back next time I'm in Perris, hopefully when the flies are less active. They were a bit annoying.

data.title: Follow up review
data.text:
We were here last for dinner a year ago and returned for lunch between softball games at the Big League Dreams, also located in Perris.  As it was afternoon we sat out on the patio - warm, lovely, and filled with families also enjoying their day.

The chips came promptly, warm, crisp and delicious as before.  We ordered guacamole, which came out freshly made, nice and chunky, and the salsa was quite good, great flavor and just a touch of heat.  My wife had the New Mexico style enchiladas, as she had last year, and said they were excellent.  I mentioned to our server that I had the crazy burrito (half chile colorado and half chili verde, which was superb) before, and she said I should try something else for variety.  So I ordered a combination plate with a grilled shrimp taco (soft) and their chili relleno, rice and beans.

The taco was delicious, the shrimp were plump and nicely grilled, and the toppings gave good flavor.  The chili relleno was quite frankly the best I believe I have ever had!  It was huge - where does one get a chili that large?!  The cheese was thoroughly melted inside, and topped the relleno as well.  The batter was light, fluffy and delicious, and the sauce was outstanding.  I have always felt the best way to judge a Mexican restaurant was by their chili relleno, and Tarasco is tops in their field!

Our server was very attentive, service was consistently fast and pleasant, and she spent time with us talking about anything we liked.  We were extremely pleased with every aspect of our meal, and glad to see the quality had not changed from last year.  I highly recommend Terasco and look forward to trying my next new dish whenever softball brings us back!

data.title: Great place to relax and have some good food
data.text: We have been here a few times and always love it.  It is small, and a little out of the way, but just a gem.  Beautiful patio weather this time, so we enjoyed the area and the music, as well as the food.  Everything we have tried here has been even better than expected, and it seems to be pretty popular with locals.  The service was great and our waitress really  was fun and helpful, as well as very attentive. Some of the better guacamole we've tried in a while, and great salsa.   Nothing fancy here, just really good food and a friendly place to eat.

data.title: We love this place!!!
data.text: The staff is super friendly, the outdoor patio is always beautiful. The food is very fresh, hot and delicious.

data.title: Mexican Patio Style Eating
data.text: My friends and I often go to Tarasco in Perris for lunch and we are never disappointed.  The service is excellent and the food is authentic and delicious.  On a recent visit I ordered the carne asada  taco plate from the lunch menu.  The meat was tender and flavorful.  It came with rice and beans, both of which were equally yummy.  The food at Tarasco's is the star but the patio dining area is like taking a trip to old Mexico.  On a nice Spring day, the outdoor ambiance really enhances the dining experience.  It makes you want to sit there and stay all afternoon with a nice tall beer.  The next time you happen to be in the city of Perris, I highly recommend Tarasco's

data.title: A one hour trip to Mexico
data.text: The atmosphere is the best outdoors on a patio under trees and trellis. In these surroundings with a other happy customers a beer and food becomes a little trip to another place and time.
